title: Heard on the Street Thursday Recap: Mostly Low Prices
description: Stocks fell again. The S&P 500 notched its fifth consecutive decline on Thursday, losing 0.4% by the closing bell. The Dow industrials and Nasdaq Composite both slipped 0.3% for the day. Most megacap tech stocks
content:
Stocks fell again. The S&P 500 notched its fifth consecutive decline on Thursday, losing 0.4% by the closing bell. The Dow industrials and Nasdaq Composite both slipped 0.3% for the day. Most megacap tech stocks closed another day in the red, bringing their average loss so far this week to 3.7%.

Walmart felt the tariff heat. The retail giant said Thursday that its scale has allowed it to keep its tariff-related price hikes below the national average. But the shares still fell as earnings came in below Wall Street's targets. Walmart lost 4.5% during the day, making the company the biggest decliner in the Dow.

Home sales surprised. Sales of existing homes rose unexpectedly in July, raising hopes that the long-stalled housing market might finally be picking back up.
summary: The S&P 500 has recorded its fifth consecutive decline, with the Dow industrials and Nasdaq Composite both falling 0.3% for the day. Despite Walmart's 4.5% loss, the company's shares remained the biggest in the Dow. The news also led to unexpected increases in existing home sales.
shortSummary: Stocks fell again, with the S&P 500 losing 0.4% amid ongoing concerns over a potential terrorist plot, but overall optimism.
